text:
In football, how to filter UEFA champions league?
i am using flumine,  is there any country_codes in streaming_market_filter for international match?
If i only filter in check_market_book with competition.id i got "trying to subscribe to 1706 markets whereas max allowed number was: 1000"

elements.text:
In football, how to filter UEFA champions league?
i am using flumine,  is there any country_codes in streaming_market_filter for international match?
If i only filter in check_market_book with competition.id i got "trying to subscribe to 1706 markets whereas max allowed number was: 1000"

text: Do you really need every market type?

elements.text: Do you really need every market type?

text: i only selected market_types=["MATCH_ODDS", "OVER_UNDER_25","OVER_UNDER_15"]

elements.text: i only selected market_types=["MATCH_ODDS", "OVER_UNDER_25","OVER_UNDER_15"]

text: My bad, guess there are a lot of football matches

elements.text: My bad, guess there are a lot of football matches

text: so true, that why i wonder if there is country_codes for international match?

elements.text: so true, that why i wonder if there is country_codes for international match?

text: Country codes are very "hit and miss". For horse racing, OK, and for local country leagues in football. For tennis you can ignore them as they are rarely correct. Same for a lot of other sports

elements.text: Country codes are very "hit and miss". For horse racing, OK, and for local country leagues in football. For tennis you can ignore them as they are rarely correct. Same for a lot of other sports

text: I would rarely filter on country codes unless you know they are correct

elements.text: I would rarely filter on country codes unless you know they are correct

text: BTW, GB is often used as the default when Betfair can't be bothered filling in the country code

elements.text: BTW, GB is often used as the default when Betfair can't be bothered filling in the country code

text: Same goes for time zones - ignore

elements.text: Same goes for time zones - ignore

text: <@U016535QCJ2> My issue is over subscribe limit which is set 1000

elements.text: My issue is over subscribe limit which is set 1000

text: Get it bumped

elements.text: Get it bumped

text: Or duplicate the strategy by country code

elements.text: Or duplicate the strategy by country code

text: Great news, thanks James :+1:

elements.text: Great news, thanks James

text: <@U4H19D1D2> Do you mean have duplicate strategy for champions league and manually enter market id as filter for each match?

elements.text: Do you mean have duplicate strategy for champions league and manually enter market id as filter for each match?

text: No just duplicate for each country code

elements.text: No just duplicate for each country code

text: You might need to combine a few so you don’t hit the connection limit

elements.text: You might need to combine a few so you don’t hit the connection limit

text: It's quite scary to hear about the number of data inconsistencies that betfair data seems to have! Sounds like a minefield all over

elements.text: It's quite scary to hear about the number of data inconsistencies that betfair data seems to have! Sounds like a minefield all over

text: Betfair data is rarely reliable. They do tend to use consistent selection names, unless they create another one :joy:

elements.text: Betfair data is rarely reliable. They do tend to use consistent selection names, unless they create another one

text: Data matching is a skill that needs to be learnt over time

elements.text: Data matching is a skill that needs to be learnt over time

text: thanks all.

elements.text: thanks all.

text:
`trade = Trade(`
    `market_id="1.2345678",`
    `selection_id=123456,`
    `handicap=1.0,`
    `strategy=strategy`
`)`

elements.text: trade = Trade(
selection_id=123456,
handicap=1.0,
strategy=strategy

text: can someone tell me what the `handicap` and `strategy` parameters do in the above?

elements.text: can someone tell me what the
handicap
and
strategy
parameters do in the above?

text: handicap is runner handicap (check out the betfair api docs as its required for orders)

elements.text: handicap is runner handicap (check out the betfair api docs as its required for orders)

text: strategies have trades and trades have orders, we pass the strategy to the trade as its then used for exposure/reset calculations

elements.text: strategies have trades and trades have orders, we pass the strategy to the trade as its then used for exposure/reset calculations

text: is handicap only relevant for asian handicap markets please?

elements.text: is handicap only relevant for asian handicap markets please?

text: no, all runners have handicaps

elements.text: no, all runners have handicaps

text: however default is 0

elements.text: however default is 0

text: does betfair change the price based on handicap?

elements.text: does betfair change the price based on handicap?

text: no its a different runner

elements.text: no its a different runner

text: ok, I see from the api specs. so far i had gone off the assumption that the tuple of market_id, selection_id was sufficient to get ex_all_offers and place orders. this is wrong.  triplet of market_id, selection_id and handicap that determines which price to return

elements.text: ok, I see from the api specs. so far i had gone off the assumption that the tuple of market_id, selection_id was sufficient to get ex_all_offers and place orders. this is wrong.  triplet of market_id, selection_id and handicap that determines which price to return

text: Thanks, Max stream connection is 10.

text:
Last hour i got warning message from flumine: "levelname": "WARNING", "message": "High latency between current time and MarketBook publish time".
Is it just me? It looks like 10-15 mins delay.

elements.text:
Last hour i got warning message from flumine: "levelname": "WARNING", "message": "High latency between current time and MarketBook publish time".
Is it just me? It looks like 10-15 mins delay.

text: Assuming you are using the latest version you should be concerned

elements.text: Assuming you are using the latest version you should be concerned

text:
Apologise, I havent used the lastest version of flumine. Occasionally when inplay football began, my CPU loading was over 100%, and memory usage is 16.4%.
I use Ubuntu 20.04. Any suggestion what tool i can use for debugging the root cause of high CPU load? My initial thought was the filesystem (nautilus), becasue i keep recording data into a file, but i have not way to prove it becuase it happened occasionally.

elements.text:
Apologise, I havent used the lastest version of flumine. Occasionally when inplay football began, my CPU loading was over 100%, and memory usage is 16.4%.
I use Ubuntu 20.04. Any suggestion what tool i can use for debugging the root cause of high CPU load? My initial thought was the filesystem (nautilus), becasue i keep recording data into a file, but i have not way to prove it becuase it happened occasionally.

text: I will start using latest version, if same issue happened again i will let you know.

elements.text: I will start using latest version, if same issue happened again i will let you know.

text: are you using a VPS? with how many (v)cores?

elements.text: are you using a VPS? with how many (v)cores?

text:
I am running home servers via Vmware. VM allocated 4 processes and 8G of RAM.
The issue was the process handling data recording via flumine was very high (over 100%).
I will upgrade to latest version of flumine and give a try tomorrow. other possibility may be filesystem issue.

elements.text:
I am running home servers via Vmware. VM allocated 4 processes and 8G of RAM.
The issue was the process handling data recording via flumine was very high (over 100%).
I will upgrade to latest version of flumine and give a try tomorrow. other possibility may be filesystem issue.

text: <@U01D3CAKCDR> has joined the channel

There was a bug where the latency warnings were being shown incorrectly on snapped data but his has been fixed. However if you are just recording data you shouldn’t be getting high CPU, have you set the streaming_timeout? Should be None for data recording

elements.text: There was a bug where the latency warnings were being shown incorrectly on snapped data but his has been fixed. However if you are just recording data you shouldn’t be getting high CPU, have you set the streaming_timeout? Should be None for data recording
